column4: i've never used type3. my first bet would be to look at /var/www/ and see if there's a folder called typo3 in there
there is nothing, that was the first I was looking for
maybe there's a typo3 configuration utility which will generate that.
there are two packages called "typo3-testsite" and "typo3-quickstart" . maybe they'll help you here
i'm just installing it now. i'll let you know what i do to get it to work (if i can get it to work)
if you can read german http://wiki.ubuntuusers.de/TYPO3
if not, we can open a private chat and i can guide you through it (provided the german instructions work)
i've never used single chat, what do i do?
look in /usr/share/typo3. you'll find the source there
how far have you got? Ive got to " cannot find configuration. this file is probably executed from the wrong location" :)
ln -s /usr/share/typo3 was the only think I must do ^^
cool :) where did you link it to? /var/www ?
doesn't work with me :( i keep getting "Cannot find configuration. This file is probably executed from the wrong location."
